Articles.Content:
hello , i have started a sandbox game with speicific  g-force tolerance , after i found that the gees were too much so i decided to go to options and set the gees tolerance to lower number BUT this didn't afftect anything kerbals still have the same g-force tolerance among with new kerbals...

anyone know how to set G-force tolerance to lower level?

do I have to tell if i have mods?

Edited February 7, 2021 by tonimark

Some changes don't go into effect until you restart the game. Did you try that? Others remain in effect for that save permanently, though you might be able to use the in-game cheat console to change it.

Just now, Vanamonde said:

Some changes don't go into effect until you restart the game. Did you try that? Others remain in effect for that save permanently, though you might be able to use the in-game cheat console to change it. 

yep i have restarted it multpiple times still nothink...
Okay, I just tried this and the only place I saw to change it was when starting a new save. Looks like you're stuck with it unless you start over. Sorry.
well we just found a bug

3 hours ago, tonimark said:

after i found that the gees were too much so i decided to go to options and set the gees tolerance to lower number

I though the setting was a multiplier, so if you want to increase tolerance you need to set the number higher, or my brain is lagging out right now 

Edited February 7, 2021 by Boyster

I've never played with anything but the default tolerance, but it's located here in your persistent.sfs file. You can edit it in a text editor like Notepad, but make sure you make a backup copy first.

(This is from a 1.8.1 save) 

AdvancedParams
{
	EnableKerbalExperience = False
	ImmediateLevelUp = False
	AllowNegativeCurrency = False
	PressurePartLimits = True
	GPartLimits = True
	GKerbalLimits = True
	KerbalGToleranceMult = 1
	ResourceTransferObeyCrossfeed = True
	ActionGroupsAlways = False
	BuildingImpactDamageMult = 0.05
	PartUpgradesInSandbox = True
	PartUpgradesInCareer = True
	PartUpgradesInMission = False
	EnableFullSASInSandbox = True
}
